intro: Pseudo-willughbeia gracilis, commonly known as the slender pseudo-willughbeia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
